alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Mobile Inland; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 1:11AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CHOCTAW... NORTHWESTERN MOBILE...WASHINGTON...CLARKE...GEORGE...PERRY...WAYNE... GREENE AND STONE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM CST... At 111 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Toxey to 8 miles southwest of Clara to 4 miles northeast of McLaurin to Poplarville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Waynesboro, Thomasville, Wiggins, Lucedale, Grove Hill, Chatom, Richton, Leakesville, Wagarville, Saint Stephens, Leroy, Clara, Perkinston, McHenry, Deer Park, Whatley, Tibbie, Beaumont, and New Augusta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
